snippet: A California judge has ordered First Interstate Bank to pay more than $13.9 million in damages for overcharging credit card customers who paid late or exceeded their credit limits.   The court found that the bank had unlawfully overcharged its cus...
lead_paragraph: A California judge has ordered First Interstate Bank to pay more than $13.9 million in damages for overcharging credit card customers who paid late or exceeded their credit limits. The court found that the bank had unlawfully overcharged its customers more than the $13.9 million in late and overlimit fees from 1983 through 1991, said James C. Sturdevant, the lawyer who filed the suit on behalf of First Interstate credit card holders.

headline.main: Bank Loses Ruling on Credit Card Fees
